page.title: 19GILLING WEST SCHOOL 1930s
page.content: Gilling School was built in 1847. {Fifty years ago,}there were a{hundred {pupils,}in{three classes,}and{three {teachers,}one being the Head. The lessons were{Reading,Writing}and {Arithmetic.}The older children went on {Nature walks,}to identify birds,trees and flowers. Naughty children were {caned}with an ash cane. The children {sat in rows,}facing the black- board. At play_time every pupil had 1/3 pint of milk to drink. At play-times,boys, girls and infants were separated. At lunch_time,most children went home.Those who lived on outlying farms took sandwiches to eat in school. When the children were{ten {years old,}they sat an{examination. Those who{passed}went on to attend the {Grammar School in Richmond,}otherwise they{stayed at Gilling}until they reached the{school leaving age of 14.
